channel.description:
what do you guys think the meaning of life is? heres what I think
To pass Gods test of course! (the test of life) what else? lol
or just to..live..well yeah if you didint live then why humanity? lol

item.title: The meaning of life?
item.dc:creator: @SaveSomeFace SaveSomeFace
item.description:
@SaveSomeFace wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:63, topic:770”]Fuck… sorry

Humans have been around for like 100,000 years… and you peeps think that you can only of gone to “Gay heaven” in the last 2000 years?

MY ANUS HOLE!!!

sciences owns religion…

the meaning of life is to live… subconciously working out the meaning of life, then when you die… you get told if you were right or wrong… if your right… you start another good life (memory wiped, regianed when you die, and wiped again when you start another life) if your wrong… you start a bad life ( memory wiped, regianed when you die, and wiped again when you start another life) . You can take breaks in between to let your soul rest … there is no time in the breaks… and you can come back anywhere in… this thing we live in… like what ever the universe is in… and whatever thats in… and so on… i own! good life for me when i die :D[/quote] I don’t appreciate, at all, the way you have intolerantly called heaven “gay.” This is a debate forum, please at least try to seem as upright and educated as possible. It’s a good way to flamed, the way you’re going about. Back to the subject… According to SCIENCE humans have been around for that many years, if you’re number is even remotely correct, and people who believe in the Christian Heaven DO believe that humans have been able to go there since the existence of mankind. Science owns religion in what, having a reason for everything? Sure, but religion isn’t based on reason; it’s based on faith. It’s like comparing apples to oranges, and whatever you believe is what you believe. It’s impossible to argue which is more right than the other, and that’s not what I’m here to do. Hmmm… and is science the basis of your “start another life” theory? I’m not sure I’ve ever seen that in any reference books…

As for Uber Killer…

uber killer:

when we die, the universe will implode on itself because time will fly by extremely fast. And… I dunno what happens next…

When we die, there IS no concept of time, am I correct?

Read full topic

@irfan786 wrote:

and that Islam is, if you will, a knock-off of Christianity. Mohammed established Islam claiming to be the successor of Moses and Jesus!
Im a ex-Christian, converted Muslim. I have been following Christianity for most of my life; age 0-21, and I probably have been actually following it and learning it for about 16 years of my 21 year span of following it. I probably know more about Christianity then you, so I say this as a ex-Christian that Islam is not a "knock-off" of Christianity. Yes, there are many similarities but there are MANY MORE diffrences. I dont know alot about Islam, since I have been only following it and its laws for 4 years now, but again, I do know that it is not a "Knock-off" of Christianity.

item.title: The meaning of life?
item.dc:creator: @SaveSomeFace SaveSomeFace
item.description:
@SaveSomeFace wrote:

[quote=“daiki, post:19, topic:770”]I don’t believe in Heaven or Hell. They are all made up by humans hundreds of years ago.

Christian people: Do you think most of the people who died “before Jesus died” went to Hell or “eternal damnation”? And now you can get to Heaven if you just believe to God that isn’t showing at any way? And if you do not believe you can’t get to Heaven?

Christian religions are quite new if you compare them to Buddhism or Islam. And there are plenty of varieties of the Christian religions. I just think they are the worst, and hopefully get banned someday… A right to believe is fine, but it’s not fine to force kids to believe in something all made up. The human mind is dangerous; it can come up with just about anything.

I know some people may not appreciate my opinion about that, but it is what I think.[/quote]

Careful, you’re stepping in dangerous waters with that. I take a little offense, since I’m a Christian, but it’s okay; haha, this is debate/discussion right?
People who died before Jesus came, died, and rose again -people in the Old Testament of The Bible- were saved by their faith that He (Jesus, The Messiah) was coming. People who lived after His death and ascension into Heaven look back on His experience. Readers: Don’t get confused. Old Testament believers were not saved by faith alone; they were still held accountable for their actions. James 2:24 confirms man is “justified by works, not by faith only.” Mopar, your belief is half-Christian, have you ever considered becoming one?

As far as how relatively “new” Christianity is to Buddhism or Islam: At the time of Jesus, Christianity would be considered a Jewish sect. I would credit Paul with turning it into a separate religion, which pushes the extent of Christianity even further back in time. In a sense, Christianity stretches back to the beginning of time, when all things were first created. I’m willing to admit that I’m not quite educated on dates of Judaism confirmation, but I know that Buddhism is a way of life (a set of teachings), often distorted into religion, and that Islam is, if you will, a knock-off of Christianity. Mohammed established Islam claiming to be the successor of Moses and Jesus! Islam would be, in fact, newer than Christianity, anyway.

Your intolerance is disgusting. I’m SURE that not everyone is forced into believing in Christianity. Don’t you think that everyone can grow up and develop independent thought processes, or do you underestimate the power of the human mind? You said it yourself: “The human mind is dangerous; it can come up with just about anything.”

Read full topic

item.title: The meaning of life?
item.dc:creator: @CToaN CToaN
item.description:
@CToaN wrote:

From Dictionary.com

[size=18pt][B]Life[/B][/size]

1.
1. The property or quality that distinguishes living organisms from dead organisms and inanimate matter, manifested in functions such as metabolism, growth, reproduction, and response to stimuli or adaptation to the environment originating from within the organism.
2. The characteristic state or condition of a living organism.
2. Living organisms considered as a group: plant life; marine life.
3. A living being, especially a person: an earthquake that claimed hundreds of lives.
4. The physical, mental, and spiritual experiences that constitute existence: the artistic life of a writer.
5.
1. The interval of time between birth and death: She led a good, long life.
2. The interval of time between one's birth and the present: has had hay fever all his life.
3. A particular segment of one's life: my adolescent life.
4. The period from an occurrence until death: elected for life; paralyzed for life.
5. Slang. A sentence of imprisonment lasting till death.
6. The time for which something exists or functions: the useful life of a car.
7. A spiritual state regarded as a transcending of corporeal death.
8. An account of a person's life; a biography.
9. Human existence, relationships, or activity in general: real life; everyday life.
10.
1. A manner of living: led a hard life.
2. A specific, characteristic manner of existence. Used of inanimate objects: â€œGreat institutions seem to have a life of their own, independent of those who run themâ€ (New Republic).
3. The activities and interests of a particular area or realm: musical life in New York.
11.
1. A source of vitality; an animating force: She's the life of the show.
2. Liveliness or vitality; animation: a face that is full of life.
12.
1. Something that actually exists regarded as a subject for an artist: painted from life.
2. Actual environment or reality; nature.

Read full topic

item.title: The meaning of life?
item.dc:creator: @blade5x blade5x
item.description:
@blade5x wrote:

Nashiu:

Yes but what makes you think only christains can go to heaven? Heck wasn't Jesus even jewish? Whats makes christianty any better then the other religions. So far buhda-ism(lol no idea how to spell it) seems the most convincing, and most realistic.

Anyways, I say the meaning of life(in my oppinion) is to perform useless tasks, and to form societies, like the puppets we are. Each of us have no purpose to be here, so I'm going to take advantage of that and just have fun.

I'm a Christian also, and IMO I think if there is a heaven and/or hell, why don't you join a religion just to make sure you won't go to hell, or wherever it is that you go? I think that the meaning of life is to live. I've also thought about it being God's test, but God has really never helped me other than letting me live, if he's real. Prayer never works, not for me anyways. =\ I believe there is a higher power out there, maybe not even God-like. Has anyone watched the movie "Animal House"? Think about the teacher's philosophy in there. It makes sence.

I think I've been told that believing in God just so you won't go to hell is an auto go to hell Not sure, but I think that's what I've heard.

Anyway, I'm not really sure what the meaning of life is. I believe in God (the Big Bang? I mean come on...). I guess he's just testing us to see if our "souls" really are good, to see if we deserve to go to or back to heaven (I think we were all once there at one point, or somewhere close to it, but we can't remember any of it).

Read full topic
